summary:
Energetic, engaged, daring, result-driven, team leader and team player.

Professional with around 20 years experience in complex (international) organizations and surroundings.
As a natural troubleshooter and experienced (project) manager able to consistently solve problems and deliver results by building bridges and networks within, and transcending, the organization.

Specialties: project/program management, sales & marketing, communications, developing and implementing new capabilities, innovation, implementation, connecting people and fields of expertise, stakeholder management, negotiation, entrepreneurship, teaching and mentoring, consulting.

Sectors: Government, Not-For-Profit, International Development, Tourism, Education

projects.title: Project 7 - Integrity and Screening Agency - Security and Justice
projects.description:
I was responsible for the start up and first phase of the project ‘Digitalising paper documents’ which is part of a larger programme called Sharp & Efficient, which develops new value adding capabilities for the business organisation.

□ Reported directly to the programme manager
□ Advised the steering committee Sharp & Efficient
□ Managed internal/external suppliers and stakeholders in both business and IT organisations
□ Redesigned en helped implement current process of digitalising paper documents
The Integrity and Screening Agency (www.justis.nl) is responsible for the screening of persons and organisations. They analyse information from different sources in order to pass judgment on the integrity of persons and organisations while participating in society.

contributors.headline: Sr. Business Analist Belastingdienst voor Ordina

projects.title: Project 6 - Licensing System Remote Gambling - Dutch Gaming Authority
projects.description:
As the project manager Licensing System Remote Gambling I was responsible for the development and implementation of the licensing system for remote gambling in The Netherlands.

□ Reported directly to the Management Team
□ Advised the Management Team and the Board of Directors
□ Led a project team (members from the Licensing, Legal Affairs and Communications department)
□ Cooperated closely with the project manager Bill Remote Gambling and the project manager Regulation & Enforcement Remote Gambling
□ Cooperated with the policy and law makers of the Department of Security and Justice in order to realise a remote gambling law and delegated legislation

The Dutch Gaming Authority is an independent regulator mainly responsible for a well regulated and trustworthy supply of games of chance and consumer protection.

contributors.headline: Kemme &Co | Sámenwerken aan duurzame verandering | Project- en programmamanagement voor een betere wereld
General Counsel - legal, compliance and risk in the gambling industry

projects.title: Project 5 - Parliamentary Inquiry Housing Cooperatives - Ministry of the Interior
projects.description: In order for the Ministry of the Interior to be able to cooperate fully with the parliamentary inquiry on housing cooperatives there was need to assess the state of their archives and information systems in which information was (or supposed to be) stored on the topic of this parliamentary inquiry. I was asked by the Ministry of the Interior to make this assessment, bring to light risks (if any) and to suggest (counter) measures. Since the inquiry focused on the period 1990-present it was quite a puzzle. Nevertheless, the assessment got done and the findings were shared with their Secretary-General who then decided on some follow-ups.

projects.title: Project 4 – Integrity and Screening Agency – Security and Justice
projects.description:
I was asked to prepare phase 3 of their ICT-programme ‘Sharp and Efficient’. The programme is meant to realise a whole new set of capabilities for the agency by updating current ICT-systems, developing new ones and integrating them. The main objective of this phase was to deliver a set of digital services for the different customer groups of the agency.

□ Reported to the programme manager and steering committee
(director of Production, director of Policy & Operations, head of ICT)
□ Responsible for defining phase 3 ‘Digital customer services’  of the programme, e.g.
▪Goals, scope, results
▪Business case
▪Project portfolio
▪Risk assessment
▪Legal requirements (privacy issues and information security)
□ Led a project team (members from the legal, ICT, production and strategy department) 
□ Prepared and gave workshops

The Integrity and Screening Agency (www.justis.nl) is responsible for the screening of persons and organisations. They analyse information from different sources in order to pass judgment on the integrity of persons and organisations while participating in society.

projects.title: Project 3 – Department of ICT and Strategic Procurement – Security and Justice
projects.description:
I was asked to help the strategic procurement team on the implementation of the planned federal electronic procurement system.

□ Reported directly to the head of Strategic Procurement
□ Responsible for preparing all the agencies within the Ministry of Security and Justice to implement the new federal government-wide Electronic Procurement system
□ Led a project team (members from the strategic procurement, control and risk department)
□ Wrote guidelines for the procurement specialists on how to introduce the new system to suppliers
□ Managed multiple technical and legal issues which arose from integrating the new government-wide system with the newly introduced procurement system from the Ministry of Security and Justice
□ Gave presentations to, and managed expectations of, all the agencies of the Ministry of Security and Justice
□ Member of both the interdepartmental Project Manager Committee (responsible for the implementation of the procurement system) and the interdepartmental Reference Committee (responsible for the specifications of the procurement system)

The department of ICT and Strategic Procurement is a mixture of two fields of expertise. The different ICT teams are responsible for a variety of things; giving advice on information security and ICT-architecture or leading ICT-related projects. The strategic procurement team is mainly responsible for making sure all the agencies within the Ministry of Security and Justice follow the federal regulations concerning procurement.

contributors.headline: Senior Procurement Specialist  at Ministry of Security and Justice, Dep. of Information and Purchasing
Informatie management adviseur financiële systemen bij Ministerie van Buitenlandse Zaken
Hoofd afdeling Kaderstelling, Directie Financieel-Economische Zaken bij Ministerie van Financiën

projects.title: Project 2 – Integrity and Screening Agency – Security and Justice
projects.description:
I was asked to resurrect a stranded project. Its aim was to deliver an online application for residents of The Netherlands to apply for a “Declaration of Good Conduct” to simplify the existing complex application process which required Dutch residents to report to their local authority in person.

□ Reported directly to the director of Policy & Operations
□ Responsible for developing and piloting an online application service (from online authentication to online paying) for the Declaration of Good Conduct
□ Led a project team (members from the legal, ICT and production department)
□ Acted as principal for the ICTU, the Dutch e-government organisation, which was the senior supplier of the technology involved
□ Wrote internal guidelines for the Customer Contact Centre on how to deal with questions from customers and how to manage technical difficulties
□ Facilitated the legal department in getting the necessary changes in law through the different layers of government
□ Prepared the agency and surrounding stakeholders for nation-wide implementation of the service
□ Introduced the agency to a new e-government building block which enables the digital authentication of organisations (e-recognition)
□ Acted as spokesperson for the agency on this topic when dealing with major external stakeholders (e.g. The Confederation of Netherlands Industry and Employers, commercial screening organisations and The Dutch Data Protection Authority)

The Integrity and Screening Agency (www.justis.nl) is the screening authority of the Ministry of Security and Justice and consequently responsible for the screening of persons and organisations. They analyse information from different sources in order to pass judgment on the integrity of persons and organisations while participating in society.

projects.title: Project 1 – Deputy Secretary-General's Office – Security and Justice
projects.description:
I was asked to lead an inter-departmental project team and implement government-wide a part of the European Services Directive called ‘Administrative Cooperation and the Internal Market Information (IMI) system’.

□ Reported directly to the overall project manager of the implementation team of the Services Directive in The Netherlands
□ Responsible for the nation-wide communication and implementation of all the directives in the Services Directive concerning Administrative Cooperation and the use of the IMI system by all competent authorities in The Netherlands
□ Led an inter-departmental project team (members from the legal and policy departments of the Ministry of the Interior, Ministry of Economic Affairs and the Ministry of Security and Justice)
□ Acted as principal for the ICTU, the Dutch e-government organisation, which was the senior supplier of the technology involved
□ Facilitated the legal department of the Ministry of Economic Affairs and the Ministry of Security and Justice in getting the necessary changes in law through the different layers of government
□ Acted as spokesperson for the government of The Netherlands on this topic when negotiating in Brussels with the European Commission and member countries
□ Presented to, and managed expectations of, all the Dutch competent authorities

The Deputy Secretary-General is responsible for most of the internal operations of the Ministry of Security and Justice.

profile_positions.title: Key Account Manager / Senior Relationship Manager

profile_positions.description:
In continuation of my special connection to Bhutan, and my drive to support them to Take Tourism To The Top, the Tourism Council of Bhutan (TCB) has engaged me as a Special Consultant.

Simply stated, I consult on a variety of matters, at the discretion and request of the Director-General of the TCB. Agreed areas for my support are, but not necessarily limited to, the following: COVID-19 response, strategy and policy development, project management, stakeholder management, communications, sales & marketing, information technology, social media, public relations and ghostwriting.
profile_positions.title: Special Consultant (remote)

profile_positions.description:
Named by Condé Nast Traveler as 'One of the best new hotels in the world of 2019', the Bhutan Spirit Sanctuary is a unique well-being inclusive 5-star luxury boutique property in Paro, Bhutan.

As the right hand of the Dutch founder and owner of the five star boutique resort Bhutan Spirit Sanctuary, I was responsible for the Sanctuary's social responsibility and sales & marketing. Given my knowledge of, and network in, Bhutan, I also played an emphatic role in local stakeholder management. In addition, from time to time I dealt with legal and ICT issues. When it became clear that the local high-end tour operator of the Sanctuary, Bhutan Soul Travel, was not functioning well, I was appointed as its managing director.
profile_positions.title: Director of Special Projects / Sales & Marketing

profile_positions.description: Teaching and mentoring students in the Bachelor of Business Administration and the Bachelor of Commerce. Improving and innovating the quality of education.

profile_positions.description: Teaching and mentoring students in the Bachelor of Business Administration and the Bachelor of Commerce. Improving and innovating the quality of education.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer

profile_positions.description: As an external consultant for ZOOP in Bhutan I was mainly engaged in improving their Billing Process. Also, I did coaching on the job for several of their Bhutanese employees.
profile_positions.title: External Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Managed complex projects and project teams, and gave advice, within (and sometimes outside) the Ministry of Security and Justice and its many agencies. Contributed to the stimulation and improvement of project and programmatic work within the Ministry. Coordinated the department's external communication.

Senior Project/Program Manager from July 2012 to July 2014.
Project/Program Manager from January 2009 to July 2012.
profile_positions.title: (Senior) Project/Program Manager

profile_positions.description: Within the expert group 'Project and Program Management' (PPM) I worked as a project manager on two projects. First of all the project 'Your Amsterdam' where I wrote a simple strategic plan for reinventing youramsterdam.nl and for which I created support among the most important stakeholders. Then, together with a senior colleague, I evaluated the collaboration between Logius and Atos Origin.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Together with another trailblazer, I was responsible for the intake and selection of new ICTU programs. The aim was to align new programs with ICTU's strategic goals. To this end, I drew up an intake and selection process. In doing so, I tried as much as possible to link the external demand for e-government building blocks to their internal availability.
I was also the ad interim program manager for the Uniform Registration Integrity (URI) program.
profile_positions.title: Trailblazer

profile_positions.description: Within the program Advies Overheid.nl (Consulting Government.nl), I was responsible for the European Invitation to tender for a Central Provision for Decentralized Legislation. I was able to mobilize the necessary support from the umbrella organizations (IPO, UvW, VNG) and all their members.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description: Within the program Advies Overheid.nl (Consulting Government.nl), I was responsible for the central coordination of the large-scale pilot project 'Decentralized Legislation' of forty-five participating municipalities recruited by me for this purpose. I also further developed the so-called Internet Publication Model 'Decentralized Legislation'. After the successful pilot, a national implementation took place.
profile_positions.title: Advisor / Deputy Project Manager

profile_positions.description: After my management traineeship successfully was completed, the Ministry decide to hire me so I could continue my work on the extranet project for them. This time taking the role as the project manager.

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Housing, Spatial Planning and the Environment
profile_positions.description: Responsible for creating an extranet for the national Huursubsidie Informatiepunten (Housing subsidy Information Points), taking into account functional requirements, procedures, privacy and security aspects, etc.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Project Manager - (seconded from HEC)

profile_positions.description:
PBLQ Dutch Institute for Public Administration (www.pblq.nl) was established as civil service training provider by the Netherlands Ministry of Interior Affairs and Kingdom Relations in 1973 and has been an independent foundation since 1993. Although PBLQ is no longer part of the government, it still is the Netherlands' main provider of civil service training programs and advisory services on public sector reform, and maintains close relations with the administration. Annually, a staff of 60 experts provides expertise to about 5,000 civil servants, who seek to enhance their expertise in public policy making, public sector management, decentralization, human resources management, management and leadership, public finance and personal development.

At the time I was a management trainee at The Centre of Expertise (HEC) which now is part of the Dutch Institute for Public Administration. Part of my management traineeship was doing a Master degree in Public Information Management at TiasNimbus Business School (1 day a week and evenings/weekends) and part of it was getting as much experience in different governmental organisations and jobs as possible (4 days a week).

□	Reported directly to the head of the management trainee program
□	Completed a Master programme on Public Information Management at TiasNimbus Business School
□	Worked for three different governmental organisations in three different jobs
(see below for more job-specific information)
profile_positions.title: Management Trainee

volunteer_experiences.description: Supporting a young Bhutanese entrepreneur in realizing her dream to become a yoga teacher and establishing her own yoga studio in Bhutan. I have helped her create her brand, setup all of her online channels (website, Facebook, Instagram, Google Business) and guided her in how to further build her brand. Together we created her business model, corporate identity (logo, letterhead, etc) and defined the business' main processes and procedures. She officially opened her studio on the 19th of September 2020, after which my guidance is mainly focused on sales & marketing and basic operational challenges a young entrepreneur in Bhutan runs into. On the 3rd of December 2020 she won the 2nd place in the Bhutan New Venture Challenge 2020.
As a pro bono consultant I was engaged in my free time in professionalizing the BARC organization on different levels, from strategic to operational.

Giving Back (www.givingback.nl) helps proven talented young people to reach a successful place in society. The foundation guides talented high school students between the ages of 15 and 18 by giving workshops on a variety of themes (e.g. Law, Politics, Debating, Networking) and matching them to a mentor for the duration of two years.
I mentored a very talented young man called Riyaz. After he graduated high school he went to college and successfully graduated in the field of Skin Therapy. Furthermore, he is a creator of Japanese influenced art works. Riyaz told me he learned a lot from me, but in truth I think I learned even more from him.
